meanings.definition: Not conforming to traditional or widely accepted beliefs or practices.
meanings.sent1: Her unorthodoxy approach to problem-solving often led to innovative solutions.
meanings.sent2: The artist's unorthodoxy style challenged the norms of the art world.
meanings.sent3: Despite his unorthodoxy methods, he always managed to get the job done.
meanings.sent4: Her unorthodoxy thinking opened up new possibilities for the team.
meanings.sent5: The unorthodoxy approach of the chef transformed the way people viewed cooking.

meanings.definition: The quality or state of being unorthodox.
meanings.sent1: The unorthodoxy of his ideas made him stand out in the academic community.
meanings.sent2: She embraced the unorthodoxy of her beliefs and lived life on her own terms.
meanings.sent3: The playfulness of his unorthodoxy brought a sense of freshness to the group.
meanings.sent4: The unorthodoxy of the situation made it difficult to predict the outcome.
meanings.sent5: In a world of conformity, her unorthodoxy shone like a beacon of individuality.
